POST.POST_BODY: I'm 28 weeks, I don't have GDMy question is, I didn't get my blood work yet, between 24-28 weeks. Will it be to late to still get one? If there's any women who have or had GD, did you have the symptoms.

RESPONSE.RESPONSE_BODY: It's not too late to take the test, but you want to do it asap ... That way if you have it, you can get it taken care of. By the way, there are no symptoms of gestational diabetes,  so you won't know till you test. You can be 100% healthy looking and 100% healthy/normal feeling and still be diagnosed with it.
For three visits now my sugar blood has been 119-137 the highest. So my doctor prescribed me with metformin. She didn't exactly say I have GD but to maintain my sugar blood this pill will help.

I had GD and I was extremely thirsty. I was constantly drinking water and especially at night. At times, the colder the water was the better. I asked my OB and was told that was because of GD. Make sure to get tested, it is very important. Good luck and best wishes!
